What should I know about data protection when using the university website?

By clicking "Accept all," you consent to data processing by DAAD and third parties that may not meet EU data protection standards. You can manage cookie preferences under the "Cookies" section at the bottom of the page.

Can refugees study at German universities?
Yes, refugees with recognized status (asylum, refugee protection, etc.), pending applications, or even "tolerated" status can typically study without issues.

Where can I get help choosing a degree program as a refugee?
Contact your university’s International Office—they assist with program selection, certificate evaluation, and next steps. Some universities even have dedicated refugee counselors.

Is there free counseling for young immigrants planning to study in Germany?
Yes! The Academic Advising Office offers free in-person sessions at 21 locations. Book an appointment via their website: [bildungsberatung-gfh.de](https://bildungsberatung-gfh.de/wen/).
